intro: Kickxia sagittata var. urbanii, commonly known as the urban arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides or in urban environments, which explains its common name. It is an annual or biennial herb that thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various soil types and conditions, contributing to its widespread distribution.
